timeline.author: ethantmanns
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+#These are the default settings for stalebot. Please update
+#comments if this file is modified. https://github.com/apps/stale
+# Number of days of inactivity before an issue becomes stale
+daysUntilStale: 60
+# Number of days of inactivity before a stale issue is closed
+daysUntilClose: 7
+# Issues with these labels will never be considered stale
+exemptLabels:
+  - pinned
+  - security
+# Label to use when marking an issue as stale
+staleLabel: wontfix
+# Comment to post when marking an issue as stale. Set to `false` to disable
+# Added 7 days to match days until close.
+markComment: >
+  This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had
+  recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occur in 7 days.

timeline.bodyText: We can try this but I wonder if this will close tickets while people are on vacation.  Wondering if 14 days would help avoid that.  Thoughts?
timeline.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: I'm open to make it longer, but this already has a long stale period of 60 days of activity so really you are talking over two months of inactivity. Can also re-open if needed.
replies.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: @pklinef with the amount of approvers I'm recommending we keep it as it is and adjust later if necessary. I think we can have people give it activity if somebody is on an extended vacation, but hopefully people consider this before vacation now :-)
replies.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: I think the default will work well for PRs.  Stale issues I could see being closed but we can always reopen them when we get back.
